summary: A complete disease system to Skyrim. Diseases progresses over time, can be cured by resting, managing medicines, potions, etc. Player can get sick eventually, can craft medicines and "diseases poisons", can learn about diseases to discover the debuffs suffered. *Compatible with Realistic Needs and Diseases*
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=lime][b][size=8]DISEASED[/size][/b][/color]
[color=cyan][size=4]- A complete lore-friendly and rewarding disease system to Skyrim -[/size][/color][/center]

[center][url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://i.imgur.com/sSbds.png[/img][/url][/center]

[size=4][color=yellow][b]Overview:[/b][/color][/size]
This mod introduces a disease system to Skyrim. Before this, diseases were merely debuffs that you instantly acquired and instantly got rid of. Now diseases progresses slowly and grow stronger or weaker, depending on several factors.

You can learn how to cook home-made medicines (after reading a book on how to do it), craft potions to cure a specific disease (or a poison to cause their effects), get sick eventually when exploring infected places, try a cure by resting or die by leaving a fatal disease unattended...

Diseases effects were carefully loyal to the original ones, but added some side-effects that make it more interesting. For instance, if you are infected with a certain disease that causes your hands to shake, you might have a spasm when overdoing physical activities. Also the regular effects have been reduced drastically on early stages and increased drastically on advanced stages.

[color=yellow][b]1. Progression:[/b][/color]
Each disease has 6 stages, being the first one pretty really mild and the last one really powerful. Each disease has a specific time to an “evolution check”. In this evolution check, it is possible that the disease evolves or recedes.

[color=yellow][b]2. Evolution Check:[/b][/color]
First test is to check if the disease evolves. If not, a second check is made to know if the disease will recede. Even without Disease Resistance, players always have a chance to resist the disease. The probability of progression or recovery of a disease depends on some factors:
a) The player's [color=cyan]Disease Resistance[/color]: If you really want some disease immunity or resistance, you need this. The greater this value, the greater the chances the disease will not evolve, or even recede. A 100% Disease Resistance yields a 100% chance to resist and go back one stage of the disease. Anything described below yields a much lower chance to resist the disease.
b) The player [color=cyan]Health[/color]: the greater the health, the greater the chance to pass both checks.
c) Is the player [color=cyan]resting[/color] properly? No resting state yields a penalty to the check, while well rested and marriage rested yields a bonus. The location the player is also affects a lot this check. Dirty places like dungeons, cemeteries, caves yields a high penalty, while staying on clean and comfortable places like home, temples, inns or even in cities yields a huge bonus. The cleaner the place, the better!
d) Is the player under effect of [color=cyan]medicine, potions or blessings[/color]? This leads to the next feature.
e) [color=cyan]Disease stage[/color]: recovering from a early stage is much easier than recovering from an advanced one. So, try to take care of your diseases in the beggining or you will need medicines or potions to cure you!

[color=yellow][b]3. Medicines, Potions and Blessings[/b][/color]
a) [color=cyan]Medicines[/color]: The player can buy remedies now to help the recovery of the disease. These medicines help a lot in the evolution check, and can be crafted after the player learns how, by reading the “Natural Remedies” book randomly available on most vendors.
b) [color=cyan]Alchemy[/color]: Initially the disease is unknown to the player. Depending on your level of Alchemy and what medicine books you have read, the disease will be diagnosed. Every disease has a specific potion that is cheaper than generic “Cure Disease” potion. The player can craft them all with the newly added ingredients. Specific “Cure Disease” Alchemy potions still are effective, but they only ensure that the player will pass the next evolution check of the disease. Generic "Cure Disease" potion just increases Disease Resistance for the next evolution check.
c) [color=cyan]Poisons[/color]: Also, it is possible to buy or craft potions that will cause a disease’s effect on NPCs with those ingredients. Check [color=cyan][i]“Grayfox’ Anatomy”[/i][/color] book for more information.
d) [color=cyan]Blessing[/color]: Praying on altars yield a random % disease resist, but also offers the possibility to cure instantly all the diseases as long a ritual is performed (check [color=cyan][i]“Grayfox’ Anatomy”[/i][/color] book for that).

[color=yellow][b]4. Books:[/b][/color]
There are two books that detail the disease system. The first and basic one is called [color=cyan][i]“Natural Remedies”[/i][/color], and explains how to deal with diseases. It teaches how to craft basic medicines on the cookpot using common ingredients.

The second one is called [color=cyan][i]“Grayfox’ Anatomy”[/i][/color] and explain details of each disease, how to deal with them , teaches how to craft average medicine and give more information on how alchemy and altars can affect diseases. You should read [color=cyan][i]“Natural Remedies”[/i][/color] before reading this to earn all the benefits.

There is a compendium for each disease explaining all its details and stages. Reading a compendium after reading [color=cyan][i]“Grayfox’ Anatomy”[/i][/color] will teach you how to craft the strongest medicine against that ill.

[color=yellow][b]5. Fatal diseases[/b][/color]
Apart from [color=cyan]Ataxia[/color] and [color=cyan]Rattles[/color], all other diseases are [color=red]fatal[/color], and will kill the infected slowly after the last stage, reducing their [color=red]health[/color], [color=blue]magicka[/color] and [color=green]stamina[/color] until there is nothing left.

[color=yellow][b]6. Random diseases[/b][/color]
The player can catch a disease simply by exploring the world now. Exploring some places has a greater chance to infect the player with a specific disease, while others will probably never get you infected with anything. Reasonability is maintained here, since it will be rare that the player will infected like this, and some diseases that require a specific form of contraction, like [color=cyan]Sanguinare Vampiris[/color], never are contracted like this.

[color=yellow][b]7. Much more[/b][/color]
There are many details I won't include here in this description. Look for more ingame. Load Screens and books have been added for guidance, and some effects have been added to increase immersion and maybe surprise you a little. Have fun!

[color=yellow][b]INSTALLATION:[/b][/color]
Install with Nexus manager, or unzip the files in Data folder inside Skyrim’s folder, just like other mods. If you are on Steam, just subscribe it and open the game launcher, then wait the quick download. [b]If you are diseased before activating or updating this mod, you will be given an option to be cured or your diseases![/b] (Mostly to avoid bugs.)
I highly recommend installing the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67973/?]Diseased - Droops Medicine Addon[/url] by [b]ezzypixel. He made us all a huge favour on implementing the Droops disease added in Dragonborn DLC, since it was missing in this mod. [/b]

[color=yellow][b]UNINSTALLATION:[/b][/color]
Make sure you are not diseased and remove the mod file “Diseased” from load order (or delete it). If any disease is left, you can use an altar after removing the mod and you will be fine.
Or use the MCM menu and choose to uninstall it. Then save and remove the mod file “Diseased” from load order (or delete it).

[color=yellow][b]COMPATIBILITY:[/b][/color]
Completely compatible with [s]ANY expansions[/s] Dawnguard and Heartfire.
Dragonborn added a new disease (Droops) and this mod didn't implement it. [s]It means that once you get Droops (only possible in Dragonborn's area, as far as I know), you will never ever get rid of it. If that happens, you can remove all diseases using the Diseased SkyUI Mod menu, the uninstall option. [/s]I highly recommend installing the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67973/?]Diseased - Droops Medicine Addon[/url] by [b]ezzypixel. He made us all a huge favour on implementing the Droops disease added in Dragonborn DLC, since it was missing in this mod. [/b]Besides that, this mod has no other issues with Dragonborn.

All you need is Skyrim version 1.6 or higher and you will be fine. I tried to make this mod the most compatible I could. I believe that it is pretty much compatible with any mod around (maybe not the ones that changes diseases), as long as you put it to load after the others.
[color=cyan][b]Works well with Realistic Needs and Diseases[/b][/color]. Just load [color=lime][b]Diseased[/b][/color] after RND and [color=red]make sure you load a game that you are disease-free[/color], or cure yourself deactivating and reactivating in-game RND (via Sugar Ball and accepting the cure).
[color=cyan][b]Works well with Imp's More Complex Needs v0.31 too![/b][/color].

[size=3]A HUGE thanks to ezzypixel for making the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67973/?]Diseased - Droops Medicine Addon[/url]![/size]
[i]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For those who understand about modding, or those interested in making mods compatible with this one: the entries I changed were the ones below. Any mod that changes those entries must load before this mod, or this one will not work properly.
Magic Effects:
- CureDiseaseEffect
- AlchCureDisease
Spells:
- DiseaseAtaxia
- DiseaseBoneBreakFever
- DiseaseBrainrot
- DiseaseRattles
- DiseaseRockjoint
- DiseaseSanguinareVampiris
- DiseaseWitbane
- TrapDiseaseAtaxia
- TrapDiseaseBoneBreakFever
- TrapDiseaseBrainrot
- TrapDiseaseRattles
- TrapDiseaseRockjoint
- TrapDiseaseWitbane
- WerewolfCureDisease
- VampireCureDisease

Potions:
- CureDisease

Dialogue:
- DialogueGenericVigilantsOfStendarrCureDiseaseTopic

LoadScreen:
- AltarDisease
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[/i]

Steam Version: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=111451056]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=111451056[/url]

[color=yellow][b]Can I interest you in some other mods I have?[/b][/color]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28329]Travel Mod[/url]: Ever asked why would you spend 1000 gold for a horse in Skyrim? Well, with this mod you will need a mount if you want to be able to fast travel!
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28264]Weighted Arrows[/url]: makes arrows and crossbow bolts weigh.
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/33325]Potions Cooldown[/url]: Potions that restore health, magicka or stamina will have a cooldown of 5 or 10 seconds. During this time they will be 10% or 20% as effective as they are supposed to be.
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/33459]Lorecraft - Vanilla Blacksmithing Tutorial Fix[/url]: When the blacksmith asks you to craft a dagger (and later a hide helmet), you will get a book on how to do it. That simple.
author: Manaflow

files.name: Diseased v101a
files.changelogHtml:
Alchemy Cure Potion now works as praying on altar: randomly increases Disease Resistance up to 100% until the next evolution check is made.
Diseases now are not automatically discovered at the moment you contract them. There is a small chance that the player notices it (chance increased if the player read medicine books), and there is an incubation time when the diseases are asymptomatic . If
Reduced scripting memory usage.

files.name: Diseased v101b
files.changelogHtml: Fixed scripts to don't bother papyrus log so often.

files.name: Diseased v101c
files.changelogHtml: Fixed scripts to don't bother papyrus log so often.

files.name: Diseased v102
files.changelogHtml: Added disease animations. They will play randomly whenever the player is in control and not in combat. Depending on the disease, there is a specific animation (Cough, heavy cough, fever, dizzyness) that will be played. Also, the greater the disease progre

files.name: Diseased v102b
files.changelogHtml:
Improved animations (no possibility of get stuck, quicker sheatening of weapons).
Added animations on death from fatal diseases.

files.name: Diseased v102c
files.changelogHtml:
Diseases now are noticeable or not. Even if if they go unnoticed, they are listed under Magic effects.
Fixed a bug where a disease could be unnoticed forever.

files.name: Diseased v103
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed Witbane's Compendium Chapter II name (Thanks to frozensnake)
Fixed issue that could possibly cause a CTD on Rattles and Ataxia
Updated version displayed on load.

files.name: Diseased v104
files.changelogHtml:
After updating to a new version or installing for the first time, all diseases are cured to avoid bugs.
Fixed the mod updating detection.
!!! HUGE FIX !!! Fixed the common crash when saving issue! Thanks to chrisnic6 for figuring out that the FormLists were bloating when saving and loading multiple times.

files.name: Diseased v104a
files.changelogHtml:
Reduced chance of getting any disease by chance.
Increased chance that when contracting a disease by chance, the disease is ataxia or rattles (most common and non-lethal diseases).

files.name: Diseased v104b
files.changelogHtml: I tried to double check against getting sick as a vampire or a werewolf. It is a known Skyrim bug, but I tried to overcome it... let's see if it works.

files.name: Diseased v104c
files.changelogHtml: Forgot to erase a debug line. Fixed now. =)

files.name: Diseased v105
files.changelogHtml:
Changed MsgBox appearance when reading Medicine Books and Compendiums so it won't bug the perks out.
I REALLY hope the CTD on saving issue will be fixed upon loading this new version. If a message showing up that the mod was updated or installed to version 1.05, then it was patched and salivas/book won't stack anymore + no CTD, I hope.
Complex books can't be read now (I mean, really read. They will close on your face when opened, just like in real life).

files.name: Diseased v106
files.changelogHtml:
Mild (Stage 0) diseases no longer have side effects.
Tried to Rearrange disease script to make it clear when a disease was cured or not.
No more weird pain effects without knowing you are sick (diseases's stealth level increased!)
(New and more clear messages will only appear on new diseases)

files.name: Diseased v107
files.changelogHtml: Somewhere between Skyrim 1.6 and now, leveled lists seems to have been fixed. That was causing a bloat, and it was completely fixed now. From version 1.06 vendors were still stacking ingredients and potions every load.

files.name: Diseased v108
files.changelogHtml:
Added MCM configuration menu (only 3 options for now).
Possibility to remove all mod's effects via MCM to uninstall safely.
Ataxia spasm drop fix: items dropped will return to your inventory after 60 seconds (configurable via MCM).
Potions/Medicines/Poisons/Ingredients chances to appear on vendors reduced.
Added a copy of "Natural Remedies" esuohsaidacraedisniinside (read backwards if you want to know where) since dealing with diseases at the beggining is a pain and sometimes the book just won't come up in vendors.
Added a menu to choose between being cured from all diseases or not when installing or updating.
MAJOR FIX: a bug that ENSURED that every single fraking day you would get Ataxia (or anything else on versions prior to 1.06). That's why you were getting sick so often, peeps! My bad! -_-

files.name: Diseased v108a
files.changelogHtml:
Updated MCM scripts to SkyUI 3.4.
Fixed an issue that caused client freezing in some specific cases of sanguinare vampiris.

files.name: Diseased v108b
files.changelogHtml:
Now medicine books and potions will appear on apothecary vendors (as intended).
Changed default way spasm works. Now items won't be dropped by default, but unequipped and rendering player unable to equip weapons/shields for a while. Old way of spasm dropping items are still possible, and can be set from MCM menu.
Added options to MCM to configure the way spasms will work, so they don't affect gameplay with inherent

files.name: Diseased v108c
files.changelogHtml: Now you can choose ingredient loot chances in MCM menu!

files.name: Diseased v108d
files.changelogHtml: Fixed: sanguinare vampiris will no more make you immortal and sick forever.
